artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Ōmiya Kyūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), nos. 166.43–44; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 287.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: two image on one sheet, configured horizontally; left image: man wearing grey, brown and green striped kimono with blue trim and red and black undergarment, holding a green tube-like object, with a flaming scowling figure with blue skin and grey hair behind him; right image: man wearing green kimono with yellow and white bird designs, lined in red, riding through waves on a giant fish, with a fishing pole held over his head
dimension: 9 15/16 × 14 7/8 in. (25.24 × 37.78 cm) (sheet, Horizontal ōban (two uncut vertical chūban))
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Beauty and Bravory in the ‘Tales of the Water Margin’ (Biyū suikoden 美勇水滸伝)
text: Uncut ōban print containing two chūban prints.
title: Left: Kurikara Kengorō; right: Hohodemi-no-mikoto
